meta.authoritativeSource: Figure 3 (Sheets 1–4) Qualitative Baseline Deficiency Flow Diagram

F3_S0_Q_CAPABILITY_CONTEXT.title: Capability Context
F3_S0_Q_CAPABILITY_CONTEXT.question: Is the System Under Test a new capability for the fleet which is not replacing an existing less capable capability?

F3_S0_INFO_NEW_CAPABILITY_NEW.title: New Capability
F3_S0_INFO_NEW_CAPABILITY_NEW.body: New Capability selected. Continue the qualitative baseline flow (NEW path).

F3_S0_INFO_IMPROVED_CAPABILITY_IPR.title: Replacing/Improving a Capability
F3_S0_INFO_IMPROVED_CAPABILITY_IPR.body: Replacing/Improving a Capability selected. Continue the qualitative baseline flow (IPR path).

F3_S1_Q_MISSION_CANNOT_EXECUTE_NEW.title: Mission Cannot Be Executed (NEW)
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_CANNOT_EXECUTE_NEW.question: The mission cannot be executed or the mission must be aborted before reaching successful conclusion.
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_CANNOT_EXECUTE_NEW.notes: Note 4: Use this path when the mission cannot be executed at all, or when the mission must be aborted before successful conclusion due to the deficiency.

F3_S1_Q_REQUIRES_WORKAROUND_NEW.title: Workaround Required (NEW)
F3_S1_Q_REQUIRES_WORKAROUND_NEW.question: The mission can be executed, but requires a workaround to ensure its successful conclusion.
F3_S1_Q_REQUIRES_WORKAROUND_NEW.notes: Note 5/6: Select YES when a workaround is required to successfully conclude the mission. A workaround is not part of the intended system operation and may impose additional operator actions, procedures, or burden.

F3_S1_Q_MISSION_TAKES_LONGER_NEW.title: Mission Takes Longer Than Planned (NEW)
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_TAKES_LONGER_NEW.question: The mission can be executed, but expected mission completion time is delayed.
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_TAKES_LONGER_NEW.notes: Note 7: Select YES when mission execution completes successfully but the completion time is delayed relative to the planned/expected completion time.

F3_S1_Q_PLANNING_DELAY_START_DELAY_NEW.title: Planning Delay With Start Delay (NEW)
F3_S1_Q_PLANNING_DELAY_START_DELAY_NEW.question: Planning for the mission is delayed causing a delay in mission execution, but the mission can be successfully completed.
F3_S1_Q_PLANNING_DELAY_START_DELAY_NEW.notes: Note 8: Select YES when mission planning/preparation delays cause a delay in mission start/execution, but the mission remains executable and can be successfully completed.

F3_S1_INFO_PLANNING_DELAY_NO_START_DELAY.title: Planning Delay Without Start Delay (NEW)
F3_S1_INFO_PLANNING_DELAY_NO_START_DELAY.body: Planning for the mission is delayed, but the mission can be executed on time, and reach its successful conclusion.
F3_S1_INFO_PLANNING_DELAY_NO_START_DELAY.notes: Note 9: Select this path when planning/preparation is delayed but does not delay mission start time and does not prevent successful mission conclusion.

F3_S2_ENTRY_PLACEHOLDER_NEW.title: Step 2 Entry (Placeholder — NEW)
F3_S2_ENTRY_PLACEHOLDER_NEW.body: Step 2 (Mission / Utilization Criticality Determination) will be inserted here next for the NEW path.

F3_END_STEP1_ONLY_NEW.title: Outcome: Step 1 Complete (Placeholder — NEW)
F3_END_STEP1_ONLY_NEW.body: Step 1 impact classification is complete (NEW path). Step 2 will determine the initial deficiency severity rating.

F3_S1_Q_MISSION_CANNOT_EXECUTE_IPR.title: Mission Cannot Be Executed (IPR)
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_CANNOT_EXECUTE_IPR.question: The mission cannot be executed or the mission must be aborted before reaching successful conclusion.
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_CANNOT_EXECUTE_IPR.notes: Note 4: Use this path when the mission cannot be executed at all, or when the mission must be aborted before successful conclusion due to the deficiency.

F3_S1_Q_REQUIRES_WORKAROUND_IPR.title: Workaround Required (IPR)
F3_S1_Q_REQUIRES_WORKAROUND_IPR.question: The mission can be executed, but requires a workaround to ensure its successful conclusion.
F3_S1_Q_REQUIRES_WORKAROUND_IPR.notes: Note 5/6: Select YES when a workaround is required to successfully conclude the mission. A workaround is not part of the intended system operation and may impose additional operator actions, procedures, or burden.

F3_S1_Q_MISSION_TAKES_LONGER_IPR.title: Mission Takes Longer Than Planned (IPR)
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_TAKES_LONGER_IPR.question: The mission can be executed, but expected mission completion time is delayed.
F3_S1_Q_MISSION_TAKES_LONGER_IPR.notes: Note 7: Select YES when mission execution completes successfully but the completion time is delayed relative to the planned/expected completion time.

F3_S1_Q_PLANNING_DELAY_START_DELAY_IPR.title: Planning Delay With Start Delay (IPR)
F3_S1_Q_PLANNING_DELAY_START_DELAY_IPR.question: Planning for the mission is delayed causing a delay in mission execution, but the mission can be successfully completed.
F3_S1_Q_PLANNING_DELAY_START_DELAY_IPR.notes: Note 8: Select YES when mission planning/preparation delays cause a delay in mission start/execution, but the mission remains executable and can be successfully completed.

F3_S1_INFO_PLANNING_DELAY_NO_START_DELAY.title: Planning Delay Without Start Delay (IPR)
F3_S1_INFO_PLANNING_DELAY_NO_START_DELAY.body: Planning for the mission is delayed, but the mission can be executed on time, and reach its successful conclusion.
F3_S1_INFO_PLANNING_DELAY_NO_START_DELAY.notes: Note 9: Select this path when planning/preparation is delayed but does not delay mission start time and does not prevent successful mission conclusion.

F3_S2_ENTRY_PLACEHOLDER_IPR.title: Step 2 Entry (Placeholder — IPR)
F3_S2_ENTRY_PLACEHOLDER_IPR.body: Step 2 (Mission / Utilization Criticality Determination) will be inserted here next for the IPR path. This path will include additional decision blocks prior to deficiency-level determination.

F3_END_STEP1_ONLY_IPR.title: Outcome: Step 1 Complete (Placeholder — IPR)
F3_END_STEP1_ONLY_IPR.body: Step 1 impact classification is complete (IPR path). Step 2 will determine the initial deficiency severity rating.
